I want to enjoy it so bad, but I just can't anymore now

è¿™ä¸ªä¸–ç•Œä¸å†éœ€è¦å®ˆæœ›å…ˆé”‹ï¼Œå› ä¸ºæŸå®¶nicetryçš„æ¸¸æˆå…¬å¸

It's fine. The prevailing issues everyone has with OW2 come down to broken promises and perceived backsliding but as someone who never played OW1, the moment-to-moment gameplay is addictive as hell. It's relatively well-optimized enough to run without issues on my GTX980. You can buy into the battle pass or cash shop if you want or just leave them alone. New heroes are tied to high levels or a buy in for their premier season's battle pass, but are typically really easy to get in succeeding seasons. In most cases since OW2 launched, the new heroes are also usually way under-performing out of the gate anyway since Blizzard doesn't want to upset the standing meta too much. I think every new hero so far has received significant buffs after their debut, though that remains to be seen for the newest, Illari. 

The game is good. Blizzard as a company is a festering shit-pit of cronyism and, culturally, a dust-ridden shadow of itself in their heyday, but this is a review for a game, not a company. Something to look out for in these reviews: Folks who make the case that the game is bad because they made a specific change to a specific character, or that because it's f2p it's not worth playing any more, or in some other way try to make the case without significantly discrediting the quality of the overall, broad elements of gameplay; most of these people are arguing that in spite of the long-standing relationship they had with the game or it's 'predecessor', it's changed in some way since then and so is now bad and not worth your time. This is a stupid argument. 

The best case against the game is I think the broken promises regarding the PVE mode, but I mean they're just a letdown. It's not a $60 product anymore, Blizzard isn't beholden to the people who aren't paying for the game which is now free to play. The only conceivable argument from a monetary standpoint is going to be from the people who are tired of PVP but still bought and ground every battle pass so they could show off their shiny new skins (which are also owned by everyone else because battle pass) in PVE but now can't. I would be astounded if this demographic is anything but minuscule, if even extant to begin with. 

Just play the game, you'll probably have a good time.
All yall just mad bout the PVE... get over it and move on. Bunch of losers cant let go

I'm an Overwatch Veteran and have played since launch but have kinda stopped playing over the past few years. Thought I'd check out Overwatch 2 and see what I've missed out on. I'm disappointed.

Where's all the promised story mode content? Why is this literally just a rebranded Overwatch 1 but with loads more microtransactions? Game kinda fell off me thinks.
